channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: Ukraine’s military intelligence said it hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army.
item.dc:creator: Samya Kullab, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages, Israel says
item.description: Israel says the remains of three people handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross this week do not belong to any of the hostages.
item.dc:creator: Renata Brito, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: Egypt is inaugurating the Grand Egyptian Museum, the world's largest museum dedicated to its ancient civilization and an effort aimed at boosting the country's tourism industry and troubled economy.
item.dc:creator: By Samy Magdy, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan has won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, The Hill

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: Hundreds of protesters have marched through Vila Cruzeiro favela, demanding the resignation of Rio de Janeiro state Gov. Cláudio Castro.
item.dc:creator: Eléonore Hughes, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Militia attack on hospital in Darfur came in waves, WHO says
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Groups of gunmen who reportedly killed at least 460 people at a hospital in Sudan attacked in several waves, abducting doctors and nurses, then gunning down staff, patients and people sheltering there, the World Health Organization said Friday.
item.dc:creator: SARAH EL DEEB and JAMEY KEATEN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Red Cross confirms remains of three hostages return to Israel ‘for the first time’ as families await answers
item.description: The International Red Cross oversaw a body transfer under humanitarian law as parties work to return the deceased to families during the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Americans more likely to oppose boat strikes, military invasion of Venezuela: Survey
item.description: A YouGov survey has found that Americans are more likely to oppose U.S. strikes against boats near Venezuela than support them after a month of attacks on vessels suspected of transporting drugs off the country’s coast. Americans also strongly opposed the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: UN human rights chief calls on Pentagon to halt strikes on suspected drug boats
item.description: United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk called for the Pentagon to halt boat strikes against vessels suspected to be carrying drugs in order to prevent “extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Aid teams flock to Jamaica to help with Hurricane Melissa recovery
item.description: David Archer, deputy governor of the British Virgin Islands, told NewsNation he's seen many organizations eager to help.
item.dc:creator: Anna Kutz, NewsNation

item.title: Venezuela's Peace Prize-winning opposition leader backs Trump's boat strikes
item.description: Nobel Peace Prize winner María Corina Machado said she backs President Trump’s boat strikes in the Caribbean Sea, placing blame for deaths from U.S. airstrikes squarely on the shoulders of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: Latvian Parliament votes to withdraw from domestic violence treaty
item.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — The Latvian Parliament voted Thursday to withdraw from the Istanbul Convention, a treaty aimed at supporting women who are victims of violence, after a 13-hour session of intense debate.
item.dc:creator: CLAUDIA CIOBANU, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: The Red Cross says it has transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel but an Israeli military official says they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages.
item.dc:creator: Wafaa Shurafa And Julia Frankel, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: US defense chief vows to 'stoutly defend' Indo-Pacific interests in talks with China
item.description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia (AP) — The U.S. Secretary of Defense said Friday he told his Chinese counterpart during talks in Malaysia that Washington would “stoutly defend” its interests in the Indo-Pacific. He also signed a new agreement aimed at strengthening security ties with India.
item.dc:creator: EILEEN NG, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Giuffre family welcomes Andrew's fall from royal status but wants more action
item.description: King Charles III has stripped his brother Andrew of his princely title and home amid mounting pressure to address his ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Jill Lawless And Brian Melley, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Palestinian militants hand over remains of two more hostages to Red Cross in Gaza
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hospital officials in Gaza say that Israel has handed over the bodies of 30 Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL and WAFAA SHURAFA, Associated Press, The Hill

item.title: China's Xi promises to protect free trade at APEC as Trump snubs major summit
item.description: Trump left the country a day earlier after reaching deals with Xi meant to ease their escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and HUIZHONG WU, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Rio favelas left reeling after lethal gang raid as families bury the dead
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Families of the scores of people killed in a deadly gang raid by Rio de Janeiro police began burying the dead on Thursday, with residents left reeling by the scenes of carnage and livid at law enforcement whom they accuse of excessive force, torture and extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Serbia youth lead thousands on march for weekend rally marking deadly canopy collapse last year
item.description: BELGRADE, Serbia (AP) — Thousands of mainly young people in Serbia embarked on a two-day march from Belgrade on Thursday, aiming to join a major rally in the country's north this weekend that will mark the anniversary of a deadly train station disaster.
item.dc:creator: JOVANA GEC, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: LONDON (AP) — King Charles III on Thursday stripped his disgraced brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicted him from his royal residence after weeks of pressure to act over his relationship with sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, Buckingham Palace said.
item.dc:creator: BRIAN MELLEY and JILL LAWLESS, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump's frustration with Putin goes nuclear, dividing Congress
item.description: President Trump’s decision to restart nuclear weapons testing as a warning to Moscow is being cheered by his Republican allies in Congress, while Democrats fume over what they describe as a dangerous and misguided retaliation.
item.dc:creator: Laura Kelly, The Hill

item.title: Cruise ship allegedly leaves 80-year-old woman behind on island, daughter demands answers after death
item.description: Family demands coronial inquest after cruise ship allegedly abandons 80-year-old passenger on remote Australian island, leading to her death during luxury voyage.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Over 100 killed in Brazil’s deadliest police raid as Rio authorities battle drug gangs in favelas
item.description: Brazil’s deadliest police raid left 132 dead in Rio de Janeiro as officers clashed with gangs using drones and explosives in the city’s favelas.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: US orders nonemergency personnel to leave Mali
item.description: The State Department ordered non-emergency employees to leave Mali as the government there comes under increasing pressure from al Qaeda-linked insurgents.
item.dc:creator: Daphne Psaledakis, NewsNation

item.title: Fate of thousands feared in Darfur after reported rampage by Sudanese paramilitary force
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — Sudanese fleeing a paramilitary force that seized a city in the country’s Darfur region trickled into a nearby refugee camp Thursday after walking for miles, telling aid workers that roads were littered with bodies.
item.dc:creator: SARAH EL DEEB and FARNOUSH AMIRI, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Trump seeks energy deal with China amid broader trade talks
item.description: President Trump is eyeing an energy deal with China, he said in a social media post Thursday. He said in a post on Truth Social that Beijing has agreed to begin purchasing U.S. energy and that a “very large scale transaction” related to oil and gas from Alaska "may take place.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Frazin, The Hill

item.title: Outrage as Swedish court refuses to deport convicted rapist, PM promises crackdown
item.description: Swedish court sparks outrage by refusing to deport convicted rapist, citing crime wasn't 'exceptionally grave.' PM promises toughest Nordic deportation laws.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 5 deals Trump, Xi struck in South Korea
item.description: President Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday touting agreements on tariffs, rare earth exports and soybean purchases as the two superpowers reached truces on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, The Hill

item.title: Trump has 'leverage' to stop Sudan killings as satellite images reveal mass deaths: Yale researchers
item.description: Yale researchers document evidence of atrocities in Sudan's El Fasher using satellite imagery, while U.S. intelligence confirms UAE weapons transfers to the Rapid Support Forces.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Texas honeymooners trapped in Jamaica as Category 5 Hurricane Melissa slams island
item.description: Texas newlyweds Kasydee and Hunter Bishop are trapped near Montego Bay, Jamaica, as Hurricane Melissa approaches as a Category 5 storm with 175 mph winds.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Category 5 Hurricane Melissa brings flooding and catastrophic winds to Jamaica
item.description: KINGSTON, Jamaica (AP) — Heavy floodwaters swept across southwestern Jamaica, winds tore roofs off buildings and boulders tumbled onto roads Tuesday as Hurricane Melissa pummeled the Caribbean island as a catastrophic Category 5 storm, one of the strongest Atlantic hurricanes on record.
item.dc:creator: DÁNICA COTO and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, WGN 9
